definitions: the state or quality of actually existing or occurring in fact, and not being imagined or supposed

examples.text: she never doubted the realness of her experience but was cautious about speaking with others about it

definitions: the state of things as they actually exist, as opposed to an idealistic or notional idea of them; reality

examples.text: there is no class in the world that can prepare you for the realness of parenthood

shortDefinitions: state of things as they actually exist

examples.text: she was so convinced by the realness of the computer-generated zombies that she was terrified
